official-title.#text:
To amend the Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976 to improve the transparency and
			 oversight of land conveyances involving the sale, exchange, or other
			 disposal of National Forest System lands or public lands under the
			 jurisdiction of the Bureau of Land Management or the acquisition of
			 non-Federal lands for inclusion in the National Forest System or
			 administration as public lands, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

committee-name.#tail: , and in addition to the Committee on

, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such
			 provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Land Adjacency Notification and Disclosure Act

short-title.#text: Land Adjacency Notification and Disclosure Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: LAND Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Additional requirements for Forest Service and Bureau of Land Management land acquisitions and
			 conveyances

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by
			 adding at the end the following new subsection:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 205 of the Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976/s:205

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, or
			 other applicable law that will become public lands or National Forest
			 System lands, the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976/s:206

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, as the case
			 may be, shall provide advance written notification to each owner of land
			 that is adjacent to the parcel of land to be acquired. To assist in
			 identifying adjacent landowners, the Secretary concerned should use the
			 most recently available tax records.

text.#text: As part of the acquisition of a parcel of non-Federal lands under this section,

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 208 of the Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976/s:208

header-in-text.#text: Issuance of patent and other conveyance documents

text.#text: by adding at the end the following new subsection:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976/s:203
Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976/s:206

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, as the case
			 may be, shall provide advance written notification to each owner of land
			 that is adjacent to the parcel of land to be conveyed. To assist in
			 identifying adjacent landowners, the Secretary concerned should use the
			 most recently available tax records.

text.#text:
As part of the conveyance of a parcel of public lands or National Forest System lands by sale,
			 exchange, or other disposal method under

header.#text: Oversight of use of third-Party facilitators

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976/s:205/ss:f
Land Adjacency Notification and Disclosure Act/s:2/ss:a/p:1

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 205 of the Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976/s:205

header.#text: Oversight of use of third-Party facilitators

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, or
			 other applicable law that will become public lands or National Forest
			 System lands involves the use of a third-party facilitator, the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976/s:206

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, as the case may be, shall require, as a
			 condition of the approval of the acquisition—

text.#text: If the acquisition process for a parcel of non-Federal lands under this section,

submission of all purchase contracts and related agreements held by the third-party facilitator
			 related to the parcel to be acquired; and

supervisor review of such purchase contracts and related agreements, the purpose of the
			 acquisition, and other terms and conditions of the acquisition.

quote.#tail:
means any entity (other than an agent of the United States) whose role in a real estate
			 transaction is to assist the buyer or seller, or both, in reaching
			 agreement in the transaction.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976/s:208/ss:c
Land Adjacency Notification and Disclosure Act/s:2/ss:a/p:2

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 208 of the Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976/s:208

header.#text: Oversight of use of third-Party facilitators

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976/s:203

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
or
			 other applicable law, involves the use of a third-party facilitator, the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976/s:206

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, as the case may be, shall
			 require, as a condition of the approval of the conveyance—

text.#text:
If the process by which a parcel of public lands or National Forest System lands will be conveyed
			 by sale, exchange, or other disposal method under

submission of all purchase contracts and related agreements held by the third-party facilitator
			 related to the Federal land to be conveyed;

submission to appraisers of contact information for prospective end owners of the Federal land to
			 be conveyed; and

supervisor review of such purchase contracts and related agreements, the purpose of the conveyance,
			 and other terms and conditions of the conveyance.

quote.#tail:
means any entity (other than an agent of the United States) whose role in a real estate
			 transaction is to assist the buyer or seller, or both, in reaching
			 agreement in the transaction.
